@/example-motion-detector.description: Demonstrates how lis3dh can be used as a motion sensor. LED is illuminated if motion is detected. Push button resets motion detector.

ByMR6eDEQD.description: Acceleration (metre per second squared) in z-axis.
ByMR6eDEQD.label: Z

HkAplwVmP.description: Acceleration (metre per second squared) in y-axis.
HkAplwVmP.label: Y

HkZ6gPEXD.description: Acceleration (metre per second squared) in x-axis.
HkZ6gPEXD.label: X

rk-xWvxP47P.description: Data rate. Options: 01h = 1 Hz, 02h = 10 Hz, 03h = 25 Hz, 04h = 50 Hz, 05h= 100 Hz, 06h = 200 Hz, 07h = 400 Hz (default), 00h = powered down, 08h = 1.6 kHz (low power), 09h = 5 kHz (low power).
rk-xWvxP47P.label: RATE

@/accelerometer.description: Combines lower level nodes to create a simple to use accelerometer.

B16PUpzQw.description: Time limit (default = 10). To convert to seconds divide by data rate. For example, if the data rate is 400Hz, then the default value of 10 is equivalent to a time limit of 25 ms.
B16PUpzQw.label: T-LIMIT

HJlTvUpfQw.description: Time latency (default = 20).  To convert to seconds divide by data rate. For example, if the data rate is 400Hz, then the default value of 20 is equivalent to a latency of 50 ms.
HJlTvUpfQw.label: T-LATENCY

HJm2IHVmw.description: Data rate. Options: 01h = 1 Hz, 02h = 10 Hz, 03h = 25 Hz, 04h = 50 Hz, 05h= 100 Hz, 06h = 200 Hz, 07h = 400 Hz (default), 00h = powered down, 08h = 1.6 kHz (low power), 09h = 5 kHz (low power).
HJm2IHVmw.label: RATE

SknvI6G7v.description: Adjust this number for the sensitivity of the 'click' force. This strongly depends on the range! For 16G, try 5-10; for 8G, try 10-20; for 4G, try 20-40; for 2G, try 40-80.
SknvI6G7v.label: THRESHOLD

r1CDUpMQv.description: Time window (default = 255).  To convert to seconds divide by data rate. For example, if the data rate is 400Hz, then the default value of 255 is equivalent to a time window of 637.5 ms.
r1CDUpMQv.label: T-WINDOW

@/click-detector.description: Combines low level nodes to create a simple to use click-detector. Detects single or double taps of the sensor.

@/example-read-raw.description: Patch to test read-raw node. Run in debugger.

@/example-read-adc.description: Patch to test read-adc node. Run in debugger.

@/example-test-accelerometer.description: Test of accelerometer. Run in debugger.

@/example-test-click-detector.description: Test of click-detector. Run in debugger.

S14E_iOGw.description: Pulse on read of device ID.
S14E_iOGw.label: DONE

@/get-device-id.description: Read the ID of the lis3dh device.

B1GvjNtMw.description: The g range for the accelerometer.
B1GvjNtMw.label: RANGE

@/get-range.description: Read the g range for the accelerometer.

ByeYzMQnzw.description: Acceleration (metre per second squared) in x-axis.
ByeYzMQnzw.label: X

S1KzGX3MP.description: Acceleration (metre per second squared) in y-axis.
S1KzGX3MP.label: Y

rJmFzfXnfw.description: Acceleration (metre per second squared) in z-axis.
rJmFzfXnfw.label: Z

@/read-acceleration.description: Read acceleration (metre per second squared)  in all three axes.

@/read-raw.description: Read X, Y and Z raw values.

HJPfMKFzP.description: Time latency (default = 20).  To convert to seconds divide by data rate. For example, if the data rate is 400Hz, then the default value of 20 is equivalent to a latency of 50 ms.
HJPfMKFzP.label: T-LATENCY

Hyt4MYtMv.description: Time window (default = 255).  To convert to seconds divide by data rate. For example, if the data rate is 400Hz, then the default value of 255 is equivalent to a time window of 637.5 ms.
Hyt4MYtMv.label: T-WINDOW

Skl_fYKzP.description: Mode. Options: 0 = turn off click detection & interrupt; 1 = single click only interrupt output;  2 = double click only interrupt output, detect single click.
Skl_fYKzP.label: MODE

rJBp-KFfv.description: Adjust this number for the sensitivity of the 'click' force. This strongly depends on the range! For 16G, try 5-10; for 8G, try 10-20; for 4G, try 20-40; for 2G, try 40-80.
rJBp-KFfv.label: THRESHOLD

ryyxzFtfv.description: Time limit (default = 10). To convert to seconds divide by data rate. For example, if the data rate is 400Hz, then the default value of 10 is equivalent to a time limit of 25 ms.
ryyxzFtfv.label: T-LIMIT

@/set-click.description: Configure parameters for "click" (tap) detection. See datasheet for explanation of parameters: http://www.st.com/resource/en/application_note/cd00290365.pdf

SktnAtKzP.description: Data rate. Options: 01h = 1 Hz, 02h = 10 Hz, 03h = 25 Hz, 04h = 50 Hz, 05h= 100 Hz, 06h = 200 Hz, 07h = 400 Hz (default), 00h = powered down, 08h = 1.6 kHz (low power), 09h = 5 kHz (low power).
SktnAtKzP.label: RATE

@/example-tweak-settings.description: Demonstrates changing data-rate and range at runtime using tweak nodes. Run in debugger.

@/example-wire1.description: Test of accelerometer on hardware I²C bus #1 (Wire1). Run in debugger.

description: LIS3DH triaxial accelerometer. Wraps https://github.com/adafruit/Adafruit_LIS3DH. Datasheet: http://www.st.com/resource/en/application_note/cd00290365.pdf. This library was tested on a LIS3DHTR.
name: lis3dh-accelerometer
